block.doc:
ESPRIT Frequency Estimator
Parameters: n: number of expected sinusoids, n<m m: dimension of the correlation matrix. Governs the quality of the estimate. nsamples: considered samples per estimate
ESPRIT (Estimation of Signal Parameters via Rotational Invariance Techniques) is a subspace oriented parametric frequency estimator.
It works primarily by correlating a series of samples in a correlation matrix, decomposing it into orthogonal eigenvectors, finding the signal subspace from the eigenvectors belonging to the m largest eigenvalues, calculating a matrix similar to the rotational matrix of two sequent correlation matrices, finding the signal frequencies as eigenvalues of this matrix.
For this method to work, it is necessary that n<m.
For another subspace oriented frequency estimator, see specest_music_vcf.
